sub_topic: Identifying the type of inorganic solid (ionic, covalent, metallic)
message_1: Which type of inorganic solid is formed when atoms of metal are held together by a sea of electrons?
message_2: When atoms of metal are held together by a sea of electrons, the type of inorganic solid formed is called a metallic solid or a metal lattice. This structure is characterized by the presence of positively charged metal ions surrounded by a delocalized cloud of electrons, which allows for good electrical and thermal conductivity.
